Correct. So the backstory on how I got where Im at started off as independent artist. I was just more so into writing. I was writing before I did anything as far as recording, but before I was writing, I was actually performing. I learned how to play music. I know how to read music. So essentially, Im a musician. Outside of being a musician, I have a passion for music. So all of that put together led me into the music industry. When I got into the studio, the first thing that I was trying to figure out, what needs to be done is, okay, so what is being recorded? What are you doing? So thats whenever I got introduced to the engineer, when the engineer said, hey, the package deal for this, Im like, hold on. Package? You mean package? Im thinking Im just paying for hours to record. So he said, no, you can pay $45 an hour and get your Beats off of YouTube. And I was telling him, I dont want something that people have access to. I wanted to be more so, like, individual, creative, something thats to my standard as far as where Im at, emotionally, mentally, all that type of stuff. Sounds that I like. I dont necessarily want to just go find something that someone just put up on the Internet hoping to get rich quick off of. So he was like, So you want me to sit here and really get serious? I was like, yeah. So hes like, the package includes the actual Beats itself, your own exclusive rights. Ill record it, Ill send it off to get it mastered, and Ill provide publishing for you either to your own company or to my company. And I have my attorneys draft up a contract where you retain all the rights, but I still get my publishing, my producers cut. So when he started talking like that, Im like, so how much does all of that cost? Feels like for five, Ill do it for 650. And immediately Im thinking, to record five songs, it doesnt cost me 650. If I went on YouTube, but I realized what he was providing for me. So Im like, if I can sit here and learn how to do all this type of stuff myself, then Id practically be able to sit here and manage myself. So I started teaching myself how to produce, record, and engineer. Then I started providing those services for everyone else, like, hey, if you want to record, I can provide a package where I can sit here and do these things for you. That started off in the music industry. Now the music group was preceding everything. Eventually it got to the point where I was like, hey, I need to be able to package everything up as actual brand, as an identity. And I was like, hey, I need a website. I dont have electronic press kit. I dont have my publishing numbers. I dont have the copyright, I dont have the legalities of everything. So Im like, hey, thats a package in itself right there. So its like Im thinking moving along, Im just thinking about say again?
